Fresno.Pacific Southwest Building: The Pacific Southwest Building (also known as the Security Bank Building) is a 16-story, 67 m (220 ft) high-rise completed in 1925 in downtown Fresno, California. With the tower's spire rising to 315 ft (96 m) which makes it the tallest building between Los Angeles and San Francisco. Original construction took eighteen months and cost US$1.2 million for the headquarters for the Fidelity Branch of the Pacific-Southwest Trust and Savings Bank.
